# The fertility doctor’s secret

**Date:** Sun, 1 Feb 2026 08:05:26 -0500 (EST)

---

The fertility doctor’s secret

96

Plus: What comes after traditional retirement, a vision of American power, and more.
Sunday, February 1, 2026

-->

 

[Rafaela Jinich](https://link.theatlantic.com/click/43793582.575659/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cudGhlYXRsYW50aWMuY29tL2F1dGhvci9yYWZhZWxhLWppbmljaC8_dXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPWF0bGFudGljLWRhaWx5LW5ld3NsZXR0ZXImdXRtX2NvbnRlbnQ9MjAyNjAyMDEmdXRtX3NvdXJjZT1uZXdzbGV0dGVyJnV0bV9tZWRpdW09ZW1haWwmbGN0Zz02NjhkMTM3MTEyYjc5NzEwNDEwOWI3YmM/668d137112b797104109b7bcCd72a8173)

Spend time with stories about the bots that women use in a world of unsatisfying men, the media’s fixation on prediction markets, and more.

The Week Ahead

[The Super Bowl LX](https://link.theatlantic.com/click/43793582.575659/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cubmZsLmNvbS9zdXBlci1ib3dsP3V0bV9jYW1wYWlnbj1hdGxhbnRpYy1kYWlseS1uZXdzbGV0dGVyJnV0bV9jb250ZW50PTIwMjYwMjAxJnV0bV9zb3VyY2U9bmV3c2xldHRlciZ1dG1fbWVkaXVtPWVtYWlsJmxjdGc9NjY4ZDEzNzExMmI3OTcxMDQxMDliN2Jj/668d137112b797104109b7bcBde79ed8a), with the Seattle Seahawks and the New England Patriots playing in Santa Clara, California (Sunday at 6:30 p.m. EST, streaming on NBC)
Solo Mio, a romantic comedy about a man left at the altar who decides to go on his honeymoon alone (in theaters Friday)
Long Take, essays about the acclaimed director Akira Kurosawa written by artists, family members, and himself, translated by Anne McKnight (out Tuesday)

Essay

(Illustration by The Atlantic. Source: Rich Storry / Getty.)

 

[The Return of Athlete Outrage](https://link.theatlantic.com/click/43793582.)

By [Jemele Hill](https://link.theatlantic.com/click/43793582.575659/aHR0cHM6Ly93d3cudGhlYXRsYW50aWMuY29tL2F1dGhvci9qZW1lbGUtaGlsbC8_dXRtX2NhbXBhaWduPWF0bGFudGljLWRhaWx5LW5ld3NsZXR0ZXImdXRtX2NvbnRlbnQ9MjAyNjAyMDEmdXRtX3NvdXJjZT1uZXdzbGV0dGVyJnV0bV9tZWRpdW09ZW1haWwmbGN0Zz02NjhkMTM3MTEyYjc5NzEwNDEwOWI3YmM/668d137112b797104109b7bcB117a40b1)

Over the weekend, the basketball star Breanna Stewart didn’t have her normal bounce during player introductions. As soon as the announcer shouted her name, Stewart walked out holding a white sign with a message: “Abolish ICE” …

Stewart’s declaration was daring because it was also personal. Her wife, Marta Xargay Casademont, was born in Spain and is in the United States on a green card. The couple is working on getting Casademont American citizenship, and Stewart criticizing ICE so publicly could jeopardize her chances.

During times of political and social turmoil, the public often looks to athletes to speak out against harmful policies and actions that are directed at marginalized communities. Doing so can be risky.

[Read the full article.](https://link.theatlantic.com/click/43793582.)

The Jarl Squad gathers around a Viking galley ship in the Shetland Islands before it is set on fire. (Jeff J Mitchell / Getty)
